info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:11PM CDT until May 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL ST. CHARLES AND NORTH CENTRAL ST. LOUIS COUNTIES... At 210 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over St. Charles, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 200 PM CDT, golf ball size hail was reported near Harvester. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Creve Coeur, Overland, St. Ann, Bridgeton, Town and Country, Berkeley, Ladue, Olivette, St. John, Woodson Terrace, Frontenac, Lambert-St. Louis International Airport, Breckenridge Hills, and Edmundson. This also includes First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 224 and 231. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
